intro: Hippocratea martii, commonly known as the Martii's hippocratea, is a flowering plant native to the Andes region of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool temperatures and well-drained soil. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
